meanings.definition: To persuade (someone) to do or believe something by using too much pressure or influence.
meanings.sent1: She overpersuaded her friend to go to the party even though he didn't want to.
meanings.sent2: He overpersuaded his sister to lend him money for the concert tickets.
meanings.sent3: The salesman overpersuaded the customer to buy the expensive vacuum cleaner.
meanings.sent4: The teacher overpersuaded the students to participate in the class debate.
meanings.sent5: The coach overpersuaded the team to push themselves harder during practice.

meanings.definition: To convince (someone) to change their mind or opinion by using excessive persuasion.
meanings.sent1: The politician overpersuaded the voters to support his campaign promises.
meanings.sent2: She overpersuaded her parents to let her go on the school trip.
meanings.sent3: The children overpersuaded their teacher to have class outside on a sunny day.
meanings.sent4: The lawyer overpersuaded the jury to see the case from a different perspective.
meanings.sent5: The manager overpersuaded the employees to stay late to finish the project.
